channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Partial government shutdown possible as Democrats fight to amend DHS funding
item.description: Democrats are demanding changes to a bill to fund the Department of Homeland Security. The fight over spending could cause a partial government shutdown at the end of the week.
item.content:encoded: Democrats are demanding changes to a bill to fund the Department of Homeland Security. The fight over spending could cause a partial government shutdown at the end of the week.
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Sen. Adam Schiff on whether Democrats will risk a partial shutdown over DHS funding
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Democratic Sen. Adam Schiff whether his party is willing to allow a partial government shutdown in order to block new funding for the Department of Homeland Security.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Democratic Sen. Adam Schiff whether his party is willing to allow a partial government shutdown in order to block new funding for the Department of Homeland Security.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: At annual conference, Republican mayors call for de-escalation in Minnesota
item.description: At the annual U.S. Conference of Mayors, Republicans were among those expressing concern about ICE's tactics and calling for a de-escalation in Minnesota.
item.content:encoded: At the annual U.S. Conference of Mayors, Republicans were among those expressing concern about ICE's tactics and calling for a de-escalation in Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Eve Zuckoff

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Democrats are demanding changes to DHS funding as partial shutdown looms, lawyers say ICE is denying detainees legal access with relocations, the Fed votes to hold interest rates steady.
item.content:encoded: Democrats are demanding changes to DHS funding as partial shutdown looms, lawyers say ICE is denying detainees legal access with relocations, the Fed votes to hold interest rates steady.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Caregivers for the elderly could lose wage protections under Trump proposal
item.description: The Labor Department has proposed rescinding an Obama-era rule that gave home care workers the right to overtime pay and other wage protections. The administration says the rule made care too costly.
item.content:encoded:
The Labor Department has proposed rescinding an Obama-era rule that gave home care workers the right to overtime pay and other wage protections. The administration says the rule made care too costly.

(Image credit: Frazao Studio Latino)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Big budget Melania Trump documentary premieres with splashy rollout
item.description: A film about first lady Melania Trump premieres this week, with big presidential promotion.
item.content:encoded:
A film about first lady Melania Trump premieres this week, with big presidential promotion.

(Image credit: Michael Nagle)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Oprah Winfrey visits NPR's 'Wild Card with Rachel Martin' podcast
item.description: Oprah Winfrey paid a visit to the NPR podcast "Wild Card with Rachel Martin," and Rachel sent us a sneak preview.
item.content:encoded: Oprah Winfrey paid a visit to the NPR podcast "Wild Card with Rachel Martin," and Rachel sent us a sneak preview.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Immigration lawyers say ICE is whisking detainees away and denying them legal access
item.description: Lawyers in Minnesota say ICE is detaining families with children and whisking them off to a Texas detention facility. They say the speed is denying detainees access to legal counsel.
item.content:encoded: Lawyers in Minnesota say ICE is detaining families with children and whisking them off to a Texas detention facility. They say the speed is denying detainees access to legal counsel.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Shockman

item.title: Two friends, an Israeli and a Palestinian, believe peace is possible after war
item.description: A Palestinian man and his Israeli friend are dedicating themselves to a peaceful coexistence in the aftermath of the devastating war in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: A Palestinian man and his Israeli friend are dedicating themselves to a peaceful coexistence in the aftermath of the devastating war in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: New research examines long-term effects of federal housing program from the '90s
item.description: New research looks at the long-term impact of a controversial federal program from the 1990s that demolished housing projects and replaced them with mixed-income developments.
item.content:encoded: New research looks at the long-term impact of a controversial federal program from the 1990s that demolished housing projects and replaced them with mixed-income developments.
item.dc:creator: Gregory Rosalsky
